doc_id: Anonymous - 1716 - A True Account of the late pyracies of Jamaica_page_19.xml
text:
( 19 )
some way or other be link'd to a few
Fishing-Boats, who went out a Bobbing
for Grigs some time before, in
a certain Water that did not belong to
'em, would overturn our Adversaries,
and make Sport enough: --- But
there happened to be a Rub i’th Way ;
for the Boats Crew, who stole these
Pigs and Poultry, did belong to a Member
of our Council; and the President
and his Brother were said to have had
Part of the Pigs, and to have made an
Entertainment for the Board out of
the Product of the Hen-roost; and
these Boats were also gone a Fishing
with the others --- This made the
Project lie dormant for the present;
but some little Time after, two of the
Fishers returned with Pailfuls of Grigs,
and other small Fry, and happened not
to be the Boats concern'd in stealing
the Poultry.—Now was the Time
to digest the Affair; — Proper Measures
were to be taken for advancing
the Cause: Therefore the Council
were ordered to be summoned to meet
at the President's House the next Day,
being February 24. at 5 in the Evening,
--- who met accordingly.
C 2
COPY
